NUf5XFTSQhWe5mgpbFCRYA.text: We walked in on a Thursday evening and waited 10 minutes to be seated, some one walked up to us and in a matter of fact way said "sit any where" and also said it's a slow night we only have 2 wait staff. We then waited another 15 minutes and one of the staff brought ONE glass of water for two of us. About 5 minutes later another glass of water and the drinks menu. 20 minutes later and no one came by to take our order, then a few minutes later we were told they were not serving dinner on Thursday's (this was at 7.30PM) he also said I'll buy you a free drink cause you waited so long - we left! He can take the free drink and ... I understand the challenges but the cheap unprofessional attitude surprises me. Won't return!

yseqqXNoXojSnYlgulfHtw.text: Casablanca Lounge is such a fun hidden gem in Scottsdale, Arizona.   Here is why it's awesome: -Beautiful, classy interior: dim lighting, high back booths for privacy -Service is always kind, courteous, respectful and attentive -Music has never let me down (depends on what you like)  -Theme nights: 2 weekends ago I went for Reggae night and it was so much fun!  -Outside roof lounge area, with plenty of comfortable Canopy seating and a great view of the city. -Music easily can be enjoyed outside too -Cigar roller if you're feeling extra fancy   Drinks are fancy, so they are a bit pricier- but that is to be expected given the alcohol brands. Drinks are delicious here!   Always have a great time. Careful taking the stairs back down if you're tipsy!

WnSW3yYjztINyvIgCzspkg.text: Needed a night out with the girls. Wanted something relaxed, classy. Good spot, No cover, reasonable drinks. They don't serve food anymore on Friday nights, but we were able to get a cheese plate out of the kitchen : )  Crowd appeared 30's and Up. Music was a mixture....

photos.caption: Photo of Casablanca Rooftop Lounge - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QkdIsULJH9QojPvLz5y-5Q.text: My wife went there for the first time recently, and we were extra impressed! We sat on their beautiful outdoor rooftop patio for drinks and an appetizer.   My wife had a nice glass of Chardonnay and I had a generous, well-mixed Manhattan. For our appetizer we chose to share the meat and cheese tray, and we were most pleased with that choice. Not only was there a nice selection of meats and cheeses, but it also came with olives, pickles, and several other goodies that set this appetizer apart from similar ones at other places.   We're looking forward to going back soon!

hlA3ECQHLc4s9i6UDMKUlA.text: Good vibes, great live music. Just a great place to go for dancing and if you're a fan of 90's R&B especially. Played quite a few some songs that took me back... even though I wasn't alive when some of them came out. I've always had an old school soul and this place hit the spot !!

RJ4Od91e6nRsSfY4AyL54w.text: Grabbed a table last night for my friend's birthday party. Cool ambiance, live band was good...they get one star because of their outrageous drink prices. We were charged $30 for a double vodka soda....like a totally normal drink in a regular glass, $30!!! When I asked another bartender about it, he said there had to be a mistake, but then was pulled to the side by the bartender who charged us that and said it was correct. He tried to explain that they gave us "3 shots" instead of 2 but seriously, $30 for a drink is freaking ridiculous. Definitely won't be back.

D1rLzWF0P5efVAsr7M-CRw.text: Great place for the 30 plus crowd in Old Town Scottsdale. We loved the live music and dancing. However, the dance floor is small and unfortunately their servers often walk through the middle of the dance floor with drinks they are serving. Show up early on the weekends if you want to find a place to sit and enjoy the music and cocktails.

nbXeggJNxvUdn-OjOW0FCg.text: Best music i've heard in a long time. Great DJ (joe malloy, the proper villain entertainment), good vibe and good drinks! And, fancy menus.

4N6GroI-bCU7OEhdgEltwQ.text: Stopped by Casablanca Lounge on a Thursday night. First impression was it's very hard to find. Upon entering, a great looking room with awesome patios. I like to think of myself as a cocktail enthusiast. The cocktail menu read well and a couple of drinks really stood out. Had their seasonal mule and a couple of shots of whiskey that were harder to find in the valley. Bartenders were great and happy with the drinks. Then the music went on, we had migrated to the patio to enjoy a wonderful AZ night and were blasted by distorted and terrible guitarist / vocalist. I really wanted to throw him a fish! We lasted about 4 songs then tabbed out and left after we couldn't bare the musical ear infection anymore. As we left we realized how awful the music really was, we heard 2 more groups on the street comment on where that awful music is coming from. All in all, Place is cool. Drinks and bar staff great. Minus one star for location and signage. Almost minus two but just one star for music. Maybe they were just entertaining one of their investors and letting his son play or something!

8tPTkyoPasjF3x3E5B3upw.text: Update: It's change up as far as ownership, but man this place was great... hope it continues! ~~~~~~~~~~~  There are so many options in Scottsdale when it comes partying, but I find Casablanca Rooftop Lounge to be one of my meetup spots with local & visiting friends. The keyword of "lounge" truly being the state of this place as it's relaxed, chill and has a good vibe.   If you looking to plan some a meeting place with a nice vibe, I still think this is a great spot for friends to come together as it offers a balcony view what chairs and awning cover that overlook a portion of the Scottsdale Waterfront area.  Live music is usually on tap for the weekend in the evenings & the night we were there, we were fortunate to enjoy the group "Level 3" that night. The music and atmosphere was a nice vibe as it was a mix of people... the biggest downfall to the experience was the speed of getting drinks to our table. Our server just wasn't available and honestly, we could've spent at least another $100 dollars. They do have VIP Bottle service with a reserved table so we should have considered, but given the small group size, we didn't expect the wait to be so long. I've done the table service in the past for another celebration and we did have to squeeze into the half-round booth (not so comfortable, but ladies did appreciate it)  The bartenders were overwhelmed at times but did a good job of filling the gaps and getting drinks out as needed when you came up to the bar. Rounding up my review from 3.8 to 4 as the server service is something that can always change from one person to another. I'm not a Cigar connoisseur but friends in our party took advantage of the Cigar Room and a few selections.

Q1N0ufHdopsZMJTLyYMvgw.text: We were recently in Scottsdale for a golf weekend and we were looking for a good spot to get drinks after dinner. I opened Yelp and Casablanca was near the top of the list, and it happened to be only two blocks away from our dinner spot, so we started walking.  We walked upstairs and into the bar, with no cover at the time. It wasn't particularly crowded, but it was still early. We made our way out to the patio and got some drinks. There was an eclectic mix of people of all ages, all having a good time in the perfect Spring evening weather.   As we enjoyed our drinks, we noticed that here was a live band setting up inside, and when they started playing, the joint started jumpin'! We made our way inside and posted up near the band, and they were really good! A quartet made up of a drummer, bassist, keyboardist and a guitarist/singer. They played all types of popular music, and we couldn't help but to shake our money makers.  We met tons of cool people that night. A bachelorette party from Minnesota, local college students and professionals, and everyone was having a great time.   I want to call out the amazing bar staff that was working their a$$ off, quickly serving the large crowd with dim lighting and loud music. They were unfazed and rolled with it.  If you're in the area and looking for good drinks and great live music, check this place out. I think you'll like it. We sure did!

aRnke4EnHfpiE8s3dnNKsQ.text: Okay, so let's start with the positives.  The view is wonderful!  The day we stopped in was gorgeous, so to spend the late afternoon outside with a breeze and a drink was a great way to escape the cold of Chicago.  We were greeted by a polite server.  He explained the happy hour special (which I was believe was $2 off some glasses of wine and most of the sharing plates).  We ended up ordering the dip, which was really good!  I could have ordered more of that!  After he provided drinks, another server began wandering around the patio.  This is where things took a turn for the worse.  Unfortunately, she rarely came to see us.  She was quite inattentive.  Close to the time we were leaving, tables around us were leaving after not being greeted for close to 15 minutes.  The place was getting a little busier, but I think it was worsened by the fact that the servers were standing around talking.  As we left, we saw them just chatting with the bartender and making no efforts to attend to their patrons.  We closed out our tab, asking for a printed receipt (they use an iPad).  We never got this, so we stopped by the chatty crew on the way out.  She then printed it for us.  We were further disappointed by the experience when we got in the car and looked at the receipt to find that she didn't give us the happy hour pricing.  It wasn't worth going back inside for $6, but it left us with a pretty negative experience.  Perhaps the staff should focus more on their jobs than on gossiping with colleagues and they could elevate to a solid 5 stars.

OzXI3rtilu9ZFUIzbjsF_w.text: We tried to go there tonight and no one was there, doors locked and no signs on the doors.  The marquee sign had nothing,  its was ghost. Too bad since traveled quite a way to go there.

MhAaKME_t0XvUu7jvx2Bmw.text: This restaurant is closed completely. I went to this restaurant Friday night (2 days ago) with two friends. The day before we were to visit, one of my friends purchased a groupon package for some appetizers and drinks for Casablanca Rooftop. Mind you, this was 3 days ago. When we arrived at 7pm, the doors were locked, rooftop abandoned and not one sign to indicate the status of the business. The week preceding our visit, we called repeatedly and tried to make online reservations. Of course, there was never an answer or any reservations to be had. There was another group of befuddled folks at the door at the same time as we were, Groupon in hand wondering what was going on. Insult to injury three fold: climbed 3 flights of stairs in 105 degree heat to find it shut down AND - YELP- why are you helping them with your reservations system, And - Groupon, why are you selling packages for this company?  I understand that businesses close, but this owner is beyond irresponsible.

but_q-IbZ1187JpLae-eTg.text: So... I meant to update my PREV review.  They DID call me back, took my reservation... and I had a blast for my birthday! The live band never showed or I'd give it 5 stars... but a DJ showed up and turned it out.

iqmh2TCYXVHV8HXHFA21LQ.text: Fun place to come on a Friday or Saturday night. Diverse crowd which is really nice, especially in Old Town. The usually have a live band and when they aren't playing, they have a nice selection of R&B or other recognizable music to jam to and enjoy your night out.   Love that they have both indoor and outdoor seating. People usually do get out on the dance floor but it's laid back so if you'd rather sit at the bar or at a table that works too. The outdoor rooftop has comfortable seating and one section even has a fire pit, which is nice in the chillier months.   From the rooftop you get a great view of the Old Town Plaza. It's super pretty at night with all of the lights and they have cool light up menus so you can see them in the dark. Great place to bring people visiting from out of town!

TxfzC2YHcGtBmpHDPCnV0w.text: The view outside from Casablanca is really nice and romantic especially around Christmas time with all the lights and decorations on. They also have live music on weekends so we will need to come for that. There's a $5 after 9pm for music. I had one drink and it was pretty sweet but the view from the restaurant was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Casablanca Rooftop Lounge - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IaV19pfxPw1Di3a-yG6foA.text: Really nice spot in Old Town Scottsdale. The ambience is very posh, with dim interior, two rooftop areas with pretty views at night.    If you cone at night on a weekend like we did, it's not easy finding a seat. They have lighted menus so you can see, and it's a short menu which is great - fewer choices.   Their drinks are great and the appetizers were so mouthwatering! I had eaten not too long before we went there for drinks, but this grilled cheese number they have... couldn't resist... worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Casablanca Rooftop Lounge - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lobster grilled cheese.
Photo of Casablanca Rooftop Lounge - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vPDG09-oCorqZq1mCVzgRA.text: During the craziness of the PGA tour weekend we were pointed to Casablanca as a cool chill spot to have a cocktail or two. Seeing that Casablanca is one of my top 5 movies of all time we had to go.   Since it was a beautiful evening we sat out on the deck. We were immediately greeted and we ordered our cocktails before we even sat down. As the sun went down the gas heaters were a great addition. Our bartender/server (gosh I forget her name but she was wonderful) made sure we never lacked for thirst. There is live music and the band was setting up as we left for dinner.   If you are bothered by cigar smoke (I'm not) be aware they have a humidor and you can smoke a heater on the deck. This venue was a nice change of pace from the other bars in the area and highly recommended for date night.

aHNVewNJREPFgPpu2wtMkA.text: A couple of my friends and I stopped by Friday night (4/27/19) around 8:20pm and we were looking forward to check out Casablanca Rooftop Lounge. Whoever was the hostess (female dark hair) needs a few lessons on customer service! She was so busy on her cell phone that she couldn't even acknowledge or greet us. She just kept smiling at her phone totally ignoring us. After finally catching her attention she didn't bother to tell us about seating or the outside bar. We ended up just telling her we were going to check out the outside bar and she just went back to her phone. We left shortly after that and grabbed drinks elsewhere. Learn some simple customer service Ms. hostess.

neX67vQfiirddUD58mAJIg.text: SERIOUSLY!!! I planned a whole birthday night for my wife starting here due to all the rave reviews. I seriously think the ownership made all the reviews. The patio was cool but not better than any other patio in AZ. Inside is a run down dive bar. Bottle service ha ha ha what a joke. Air conditioning was obviously broke but that didn't stop them from seating us in a blazing booth instantly dripping sweat how stupid the girl who sat us  there could be, to not realize how hot it was in that back room and offered nothing except to disappear and never come back, so we found our own place to sit near  A portable air conditioner that they had set up by the front door. Where we then stayed and waited for our guests. Once our guest arrived we immediately got out of there. h4SqEXvEfWD99DNwUKlDCQ.text: Hello!   I have been trying for months to book the lounge space on the rooftop for the evening of Friday, Dec. 7th. I have called, left voice mails, emailed, and nothing. So here I am on social media hoping this works.  Thank you

r_oqmBXbDSMofgtrdUnCtg.text: Great little nightlife spot in Old Town. Friday nights Are hip-hop/R&B with live music then DJ. The spot has a private VIP lounge, dance area, and patio partying in different areas. The doorman, host, service staff and servers are wonderful to work with. The Promoters for table service are also very nice. The lounge is neat and classy. It's always a good time with a great crowd.   The food is very good here. Plenty of tables to sit down and enjoy a meal.

cf2Oa9bTwSeqZaOONT1dDw.text: without a doubt the worst service I have ever received ... last night, Thursday Oct 24th, we arrived at the lounge which is absolutely beautiful ... a band was playing and they were wonderful ... we were three of maybe 20 customers in the entire place and we took seats at the bar. it took a good 8 to 10 minutes for the bartender to get to us although we were trying to get her attention ... she appeared to be a new bartender as she was searching for bottles and did not seem to know the location of things behind the bar. we enjoyed our cocktails and listened to the band, after about 25 or 30 minutes I was ready for another cocktail, try as I may I could not get the bartenders attention, mind you, at this point there were maybe only 10 customers in the entire bar including the patio area ... I finally got the attention of the manager who came behind the bar and he got me a second cocktail.  during the time that he was getting my cocktail the band took a break between sets, when the band was ready to start the final set, it took about 7 or 8 minutes for them over the microphone to get the attention of the manager and bartender to turn off the house music ... at this point there are only 5 people in the bar who were all laughing because it was so funny that the band could not get the attention of the employees, the manager finally turned off the house music and the band began playing the final set, at this point my two friends were ready for their second cocktail and we again could not get the attention of the bartender or the manager ... we were literally waving our arms for a good 5 minutes trying to get their attention, I finally got up from my seat and walked to the end of the bar where the manager was socializing with the bartender and I asked him if I could speak to him for a moment to which she said sure and stepped from behind the bar to talk to me and I explained to him that although the bar was beautiful and the band was very engaging and wonderful that the service was absolutely horrible ... his response was, and I quote " well then I think you've had enough and you guys should leave", absolutely no apology for the poor service, just told us to leave, mind you, my friends were still waiting for just thier secnd drink and I was still enjoy my second. I absolutely will not be back and I will be contacting the general manager to discuss the situation.  On a side note, The manager on duty seemed to be flirting and making himself very familiar with the bartender. I did pay my $30 tab and tipped the bartender $5 ... even though the service was very slow, she was friendly and again it was obvious that she was new.  The managers attitude on the other hand was horrific and completely unacceptable.

kIGhXIiOCyzeVSnnfj64hQ.text: Yes, the place is nice, but it is True, the service needs a lot of work.  When I came in, I asked the hostess to direct me to the group of girls I was meeting.  On my way there, I girl jump on my path, I didn't know who she was, but she was so rude, she cut me off, and on top she gives me the "EXCUSE ME" with the two snaps and a zig zag attitude. Later I realized she was a server.  Way to go, customer service.  I just laughed it off, because I was going to have fun with my girls.  I love meeting girlfriends out and there is very little that can upset me enough to not enjoy my night.  I really wanted to like this place, but the owners need to hire more experienced management and servers.  Not everyone is cut out to do customer service, specially in the "service industry".  My drink was good, I stayed with a safe bet I have had before.  I asked if I could have a taste, instead our server said she would ask the bartender to match my taste and  if I didn't like it she could switch it. I hate returning drinks.  It would have been so much easier to just let me have a taste and if I liked it, I would have had it.  The cheese platter was really pathetic for $25.  Hopefully they will take care of the kinks, because the place is very nice and the music was great.  This could be such a great place to hang out with friends and chit chat, without loosing your voice.

Vh-35_7TQdT9YqULX1guZA.text: A great new place for cocktails and edibles in a high-end atmosphere. The staff is extremely attentive, friendly, and helpful. The decor and design are impeccable, and the location is both convenient and comfortable. This place brings creativity to new heights, and combines the best of all worlds into one extraordinary place.

i7qdWSOm5vvtLHzbCJ2n9A.text: Worst place in Old Town Scottsdale. Do not waste your 10 bucks walking in the door if you want actual customer service.

SuHl1K0KAgmLrPTOM7UadA.text: My husband and I went here on a Friday for date night. I enjoyed the decor and the outside patio. It was a nice crowd and you can tell the people came dressed to impress. The DJ on the outside patio was superb and the views of the city made the evening. I really wanted to kick up my heels with the crowd but the music was too loud for the space and the inside seating was very limited unless you reserved a table.

TFyf9pFNaVZUBT010veSRA.text: Comfortable, loungie atmosphere inside with a nice patio outside on the 2nd level of a building at Southbridge in downtown Scottsdale. There was live music the night I was there. If you sit at the bar, you order your drink off of an Ipad. In my opinion, this is very impersonal. I couldn't request a certain drink off the ipad either, so we waited to order from the bartender. He was super busy and when he finally took the time to talk to us, he didn't seem enthusiastic about making a drink that wasn't on the menu.  In the end, my drink did turn out pretty good (some mixed whiskey drink), but that's not the only reason I go to a fancy bar. I expected a friendly bartender ready to bestow some mixology wisdom on me! This didn't happen. I recommend going during happy hour, if they have one. The drinks are very expensive.

XyavdS3ZgQgZ6GrVEcm_8Q.text: First time there..loved the interior lounge, velvet slipper chairs, low tables, window seats, intimate yet open, dark rich colors, warm lighiting. Out door patio several seating areas a fire pit. All comfy and cozy seating. Ginger Basil Ciphirina...WOW! Great music and on Friday nights a jazz trio. I am definitely going back there with my husband next time.

J4qz4jGM_OrMP0D1GDqhaA.text: It's places like these that really makes me hate going out in Scottsdale.  A pretentious, somber lit establishment where waitresses look like Dita Von Tease.  The one pro of this place is the lit up menus.  Those are pretty rad.  I will not be coming back!!

EC5aEsQ-eAEkOOCNmqXjLg.text: I just went to this place yesterday with my older sisters for the first time.  The Casablanca is awesome!  Before I was 21, I would always walk by this place hoping to visit it someday.  When I went inside, this place was much classier than I imagined.  My sisters and I opened up our menus and were in awe of their light-up menus!  I think I kept opening and closing mine for a short while, lol.  Everything is clean and prestine.  When my beer arrived, it was in a beautiful glass with NO water stains whatsoever!!  This is not a place where you have to check your glass to make sure there aren't lip stains from a previous customer...  Jimmy and Ken were the bartenders taking care of us last night.  They were both VERY friendly and funny!  Ken should be a comedian!!  He had my sisters and I laughing for 2 hours!  Yes, the drinks are a bit pricey, but the drinks are fabulous!  It is definitely a treat to go to The Casablanca, and well worth the price.  :)

eQL2o8WmhpgjOIxFIFwX4g.text: 4 stars for the patrons that attended. good looking, generally friendly, and hardly any douchebags. 2 stars for the cleanliness. I was there last night for a reserved, catered party and even though the food had run it's course on the patio, nobody cleaned it up. fantastic decor coupled with disgusting expired looking food 2 stars for the bar service. ordered drinks three times and despite being at the barfront, it took 15mins each time to get a drink - which was generally underserved and overpriced. and this wait time wasnt just because sex girls were getting served... the bartenders were just that poor 3 stars for the ambiance. music, staff, mood of the club.  2.75 stars overall. with places similar to this such as mabels and az88, i prob wouldnt go back to this place unless invited.

_l7zGKLJ2IRDODsrZ5c7TQ.text: Our 4 person group stopped here for a drink before dinner and were pleasantly surprised! Although it took us a minute to figure out how to get to the lounge, it surpassed out expectations! The atmosphere was perfect for cocktails and the outdoor space with a fire pit was wonderful. I had a "seasonal mule" and it was quite possibly the best drink I've ever had! The live music was a very nice touch also. Would definitely recommend and looking forward to going back!

_wv7WoDCh-P-W9fm1ABfOA.text: My friend and I just went in, asked for cocktail menus, and then sat for 20 minutes trying to get the bartenders attention to take our orde.r, while he immediately took the orders of groups of men who .walked up to the bar. It wasn't even crowded and it was completely futile to get a drink in there. Needless to say we walked out drinkless.

dHbZR02h-qj4_uYset1ZEw.text: I went here for my 21st birthday last night and I do not think I could have had a better time. It started when my friends and I arrived and was greeted by Taylor the Hostess who was so welcoming and friendly. Trisha the event coordinator was absolutely amazing and so accommodating to my every wish. We sat outside on the patio by the fire pit, and it was probably the best seat in the house It was so comfortable for my 15-20 person party. Ashley was our server and she was the best. She had great recommendations and knew EXACTLY what she was talking about when it came to explaining all the different drinks. Rich the Bar Manager was just as wonderful and even created a special drink for my birthday so my friends and I could enjoy something personalized just for me. Prices were totally fair, music was great to dance to outside, and the view from the patio was to die for. I am so so happy I came here for my birthday, and will continue to come here. Again thank you so much everyone. :)

oklSzJR8Dz52wRXDXiVXTg.text: I made reservations here last night for a group of girls on a bachelorette party.  When we got there our table was ready with a reserved sign on it.  The host seated us and the fun began.  We had drinks flowing and were enjoying the atmosphere and music.  The singer was very engaging and we had a blast dancing with the group.  We were positioned close to the stage and we just was able to engage with the staff and the band.  I would highly recommend this spot. IT was roomy and had a great feel to the place. Our waitress was adorable and spot on with keeping to our group of 11!! Thank you Casablanca for a good time!

-Q_F_mAOyftYturl41zO0A.text: In the 30 minutes I was at Casablanca, I was underwhelmed. To say the least. The service is absolute shit. It's a really great atmosphere and there was an amazing live band and I even liked the light-up menus, but the service killed it for me. The manager tried to come over and salvage an experience that was spiraling downward for myself and seven other girls. She made it worse. Trying to get our checks sorted out was a nightmare. I almost felt sorry for our server because she clearly wasn't capable or prepared to handle a table of eight. We were told she was new by the manager, which I also didn't like. Why would you assign a new server to a group? She didn't know what was in the drinks and wasn't familiar with the menu. One of the girls in our group had to flag down the manager just to get my one (and only) round of drinks. I'd love to give this place another shot if they can invest in better service. The company, however, was fabulous! To all the ladies out on Saturday night, I had a blast with you all! Despite the Casablanca shitstorm. Does anyone know the name of the band that was playing there on Saturday? I'd definitely love to see them again (at another venue!).

g_MTO9-PToWfQREYT37Shg.text: This place is not organize and has management problem, we had a birthday celebration and everyone decided to meet up at the lounge at 8pm,there was about 15 people in our group, I was expecting a server within 20 minuets, our table was outside and it was hot and humid, 45 minuets later still no server and we are so thirsty and uncomfortable, I went to the bar and I asked a waitress if we can have a table as I see there was a lot of vacant tables, server explained that in order for me to be set inside I have to spend a minimum of $160.00 and I asked per table ??, server replied "no each one has to spend 160.00" per person, this is ridiculous !!!  @9pm there was 4 waitresses inside just happy chatting away and there was no server outside within an hour, I heard another table complaining about service, we walked out the place at 9pm and went to another restaurant to eat and drink and came back to Casablanca to join our friends again, and stayed just an hour and had 1 drink, all the time I was in Casablanca and  1 round of drinks to birthday girl, we could have spent more money on this place, I would rather spend our money someplace else that deserves our welcome, because of the service fiasco and the way your snooty server treated me and my friends we will not come back to this place, whoever owns this place my heart goes out to them, this place  is a money pit and their staff and management are huge liabilities, band is great and location is great, I am a business owner and entrepreneur..shame how they handle business.

v4GLVV0gcsBLomHFZmTK3g.text: I wouldn't know they wouldn't let me in, pretty much discriminated against.  The door man is not the owner but believes he is.  Thanks for letting me not spend money at your joint.

p_pAWopqBqKRqdPE0SPoMQ.text: I always have a good time when I come here. I don't go to people watch or even really to drink, I come for the dj on the patio. 0fv1S6-09aEdwu6QYS6mYg.text: Wow Has this place gone downhill. Now we get attitude and poor cocktail skills The people who opened this place are gone, and it shows I won't be back. Not fun any more.

I3Hl3BkM0C3nwbOeB4E1nw.text: Cool spot. Great vibe. Good crowd, Well made cocktails and friendly staff. Will defintely want to go back there. Haven't tried the food yet, but that's happening next visit.

qerjDoYGpGZyTlHzqICJMg.text: If your looking for a low-key place to have a couple drinks, this is the place. The balcony has awesome views and its in the heart of old town. Its a must try at least once or twice. The menus are electronic! Innovative, I must say :)

Hf_umdmplnMXwhIsnqsH9Q.text: They pair drink with a cigar for you, play live bongos and sometimes there is movie night. Great chill bar on a rooftop with river view.

WTzllgl6KEsWW8hot-kKyg.text: This hidden speakeasy is the epitome of class and ambiance. This is not the kind of place you accidentally stumble into. It's the kind of place where you would see the lights on the rooftop patio and wonder what's going on up there. Parking can be a challenge so I suggest valet parking.   The lounge is dimly lit and cozy, yet definitely upscale. The clientele ranged from 30's to early 50's. Seating is very comfortable and perfect for long conversations. They layout is arranged to allow adequate privacy and intimate conversations.  The "mixologist" (aka bartender) is friendly. Made us feel like old time friends. The server was a wee bit on the snooty side, but friendly enough and quick to empty ashtrays and check on us.   Outside, is a rooftop patio which quickly became my favorite area. There are misters under the cabana portion of the patio as well as sofa seating. Open seating consists of comfortable chairs and side tables. Outdoor heaters are present for chilly nights.   Entertainment that evening was a vocalist, accompanied by a guitar player and bongo player. She was talented as were the other two. Her voice was soothing and it was the perfect compliment for this type of environment/establishment.   The drinks were generous, well presented and flawlessly made. They were not watered down or weak. I was expecting a dainty little glass for my cocktail, but it was presented in a large, chilled tin cup and garnished beautifully. So speakeasy-esque.   This is the perfect place to enjoy a good cocktail and cigar, whether you're unwinding after a long day, or gearing up for a night on the town.   I will definitely be back. As often as I can.

othbdQjCgDeX4ya7TLt6Nw.text: Great atmosphere!!! Staff was very attentive... Saturday night with the live bands are the best :)

qHeTmNf1rDW0qwPseeQjzg.text: I've been here a few times before and thought it was a pretty cool place..I love lounges, great patio, good place to hang out with friends and have a drink.....but that was last year.    Walked in here last week on a weeknight.  There wasn't a single person in the place.  The bartender and the waitress were kinda hanging out.  Bartender hands us menus.  I ask if they have blue cheese olives to make a dirty martini.  He gives me some story about how they can't because they aren't a kitchen (huh?..whatever) and he walks back into something that looks like a kitchen.  Then he doesn't come back.  And doesn't come back.....5-10 minutes go by and we are awkwardly sitting at the bar wondering what the heck just happened?!!..  So we leave.  Clearly they didn't want to have to serve customers.  This place needs to either shut its doors or get better service that cares about keeping customers there.

Ii_R5X-rt6GOBrh5_ld1Hw.text: The decor of this place is really neat. It's dim and intimate inside (in fact, it's so dim they have to give you a menu that lights up!) and they have some really comfy chairs to sit on. The DJ who was working on Saturday night was playing some fun music, but the volume was a little too loud for a "lounge."  I could only talk to the people sitting immediately next to me, and even then I had to yell a little.  The patio was a nice escape from the loud music.  They had a lot of seating out there and a nice view of the courtyard to people watch.

Qeto85UFnhy_ZkJDIruFJA.text: Great place to relax and soak in the ambiance. The drink prices reflect the high quality assortment they carry. Nice selection of single malt Scotches by the way! The outdoor patios (3) are cool. The patio allows you to enjoy a cigar with your adult beverage. Always a plus. The service was outstanding all night long.

CllIUZ4I1yvGlDK8ms_Dig.text: I'm giving this place two stars; one for having good food and drinks and one for having a great atmosphere.  However I did not feel like I had a good experience here last night.  A Group of friends and I sat on the patio last night. The gentleman in our group was about 150 pounds and he sat in one of the patio chairs.  Within the first 10 minutes of arriving one of the legs on the chair broke and my friend fell flat on his back on the patio. The manager or supervisor never came over to make sure he was OK and not injured. Later in the night a server brought over an extra martini that we did not order. We triple check to make sure that everyone had a drink before she set it down and we said we did not order that, everyone has their drink nobody is done with their drink yet. She left it on the table and said "I'm sure someone will drink this if I leave it here" and still charged us for that drink that nobody drank. Finally when it came time to go I was in a little bit of a rush to get home when I realize the server hadn't come back to our table for half an hour.  It took us half an hour to get our check, we had to stand up and get her attention to come over and bring us the check. This place is beautiful with a great atmosphere and great food and drinks and has such potential to be five stars. Unfortunately, The experience we had was terrible.

yG5aTNNC1wEfyLTpVWaznQ.text: Horrible experience. Called ahead and was told they don't require reservations. Arrived and was told the owner was having a private party on the patio and someone from the restaurant had wandered out there so they closed the restaurant down so they wouldn't be disturbed Will never go back and will tell everyone about the terrible experience

Nh2kwcZte_MmHxIw2fK2FA.text: Excellent food ! Great view, and the hottest and most classiest women around.. I have been to many clubs seeking some nice women and this place surpassed any club that I've ever been to in the Phoenix area and I will continue to go there enjoy myself like I always do thanks so much for your great ambience classy women to mention beautiful women and the delicious food !!!

fOehE473myyVFXhxntwn-Q.text: Loud!! I can't hear myself think. The music was unnecessarily loud both times I went here. Bring your earplugs and it might be tolerable. Really loud karaoke sounding band on Wednesday night... So fun!

W2OuEiBYOBm1XgnS8GlBkg.text: Kenny and Jimmy were the best bartenders ever!!! They were so genuinely nice and made us feel so welcome! Ken definitely has a gift to make people laugh. My sisters and I felt like we knew him all our lives. We will be back!!!      Thanks Jim and Kenny!!!!!

5DwIOkYu_uEoYLsMfNTxrg.text: Ok. Well last night was horrible. It started off ok. We arrived waited 20 mins at the door then were taken to our table.The table I purchased was advertised for 12 guests at a cost totaling $1483. When we sat down it was only prepped for 6! No way to seat 12 comfortably. 6 glasses for drinks & 6 for champagne! So we order Drinks and mixers and we're ready to start the night. I ordered 3 apple Ciroc and one grey goose. So out to the table comes two big apple Ciroc one small Apple Ciroc bottle and a regular vodka. I ask the girl about it and she apologized and brings the regular size Apple and never returns with grey goose. She pours our drinks which I have to help with because her arm is broken and she's struggling opening bottles and pouring them. As the night goes on we basically never had a waitress again we never had refill on mixers never had more cups no ice everything was empty all night we had to go to bar and ask for cups which they didn't have and ask them to fill up our empty cranberry craft, pineapple bottle, and orange juice bottle, And then ask Another table to use their cups. We ordered food that never came and to top it off we had no champagne ever it never arrived! We had no toast for the New Years count down! Waitresses would occasionally walk by and if we asked for something we needed it never was delivered back. The total price included mandatory tip. This establishment was completely unprepared for the New Years event and sad the patrons were the ones who had to suffer on such a special event for many!

photos.caption: Photo of Casablanca Rooftop Lounge - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Almost New Years our 6 empty champagne flutes! Sad New Years wish we could redo!

jHwrnAsJUkh92Kau8Y0Pgg.text: Nice lounge, good views and neat menus. The service had high points and low points. Upon walking in and wandering around looking for a place to sit down a waitress approached us and offered to help find our group a place to sit down and relax. Within 5 minutes she had a large seating area cleaned and ready for us. The low point was when I ordered a vodka martini on the rocks with a twist but got a regular martini, in a martini glass, with an olive.  I thought that was a bit odd for a high end lounge but maybe I should just learn to order more popular drinks in the future.    Full disclosure - I am rooting for these waterfront places to succeed. It has been a tough few years and I admire the business owners who keep putting these places out there hoping that one day their venture on Southbridge will make it for the long haul.

fDL7uMw1qWu1JgxtFbstiw.text: This place is great. Each dish is carefully made and they always make sure the customer is happy. Top shelf drinks, food, and staff... But more importantly the atmosphere. Shelly our bartender/waitress and all the staff members are so nice and attentive. I cant say enough good things about this Lounge! Simply put, if you get a chance to go, go. Just. Go.

NJ5fxk1P3bbavxePwPD2sw.text: I wish I knew about this place before just last week. After dinner at the Herb Spot, we went upstairs to the lounge. I had no idea what i was getting into.  The evening I went, the crowd was much older.  There was a band playing with the smooth sounds of George Hamilton busting out some Motown and R&B hits and sounded really good.  There is a nice outdoor area.  I'd much rather head to this place to hang out for drinks then some of the trendier places around the area.  Drinks are reasonable and received my drinks pretty quickly.

3aT6hvhGUtVeDavoC9mdRQ.text: The dj system was like for a house party.  I paid $550 for a table plus a $100 mandatory tip, I waited a hour before I saw a server to give me ice or mixers for my bottle service then only twice throughout the night. I had to go to the bar myself to get mixers on table and bottle service.  Horrible service! Would give them negative stars if I could.

MqtJW0Lu1AciiBjxzCjW-g.text: We made a reservation for a table for my birthday on a Saturday night.  Mind you it's my birthday and we're going to Pop bottles and spend money like Bruno Mars in 24 Karat.  They tell us there's an entrance fee (umm, we had a reservation we made 2 weeks in advance with the Manager) even if we had a table.  Why the heck would we pay for an entrance fee if we have a table and will spend hundreds of dollars.  It's very distasteful for them not to warn us about this when I made the reservation with the manager 2 weeks in advance.  It was my birthday and I was so disappointed at the principal and the way they acted (not even apologizing, acting like total douches) my 15 person party left, all of us and our money.  No thank you!

t0vQtl04wIY9VmjIQbc0vg.text: Nice spot.. I liked the fact the that its a 30+ crowd. Nice balcony seating if you want to be outside. They allow you to bring your own cigar's or you can purchase from their selection. The DJs were pretty good as well.

z06RkytsBEwurCiFXsTZkw.text: Really cool joint. Very nice view from the deck, excellent music, good drinks. The food is a little different but really good. A great way to spend an evening out!

kdSxOx5gW9uppwFRuuQCIw.text: The NYE PARTY is over priced with poor service. We purchased the table with bottle service and were required to include gratuity. It's clear why this is required. The service is poor and if it were not required, they wouldn't make tip. While I understand this is their "busiest night" one would think they would be prepared for this event as it only happens once per year.   Additionally, the club advertised no waiting when a VIP table was purchased. We waited nearly 20 min and an addtl 30 for a waitress to provide the mixers and open our bottle. Finally, the changed and increased the price twice, claiming incorrect information on their FB page. Not exactly the customers problem. STAY AWAY FROM HERE...save your money and hit somewhere, anywhere else.

0Qav42iysdn1n43KAgdRbQ.text: Went here for a friend's birthday. We had a table and bottle service. Dj was great. Danced the night away. Loved the patio areas. The service was pretty good. Overall a fun atmosphere and good for small groups. Enjoyed the fact that the crowd was not too young. Lots of 30 somethings. Will definitely go back.

gcyugJFithMGIOytj9howw.text: Fun location and the layout makes for an eventful night...Bathrooms were pretty clean so that is a big plus for a night club

UyJ3oqr8Q0Yy4qUAKHs9dw.text: If you are looking for something unique and satisfying check this place out. I love the welcoming, knowledgeable staff, the comfortable lounge and possibly the best patio in the valley (and I love patios). Great music, awesome staff, amazing selection of liquor and most importantly: a patio to die for. A must see on Scottsdale!

RHDtt0u-3xTnGkZjdhluhQ.text: I really enjoyed my time there. Live Music and environment was excellent. They also have a. Wet good food menu.

t0XEE3E8j1Pchcyr0bj6Cg.text: I think this place is at 3.5 stars for the moment, but I will round up based on my drink and bartender alone!  The 5 STAR moment: I had a VERY VERY good Tom Collins, made by a handsome bartender.  My friend and I decided to move to a table since we decided to order food, and the bartender continued to serve us, even though he had to continually walk around the bar.  It was nice and professional of him not to switch us over/close us out. The management was also very polite to come over to inquire about our experience at Casablanca.    The unfortunate part in our experience was our food was VERY late.  I know the food comes from the Herb Box, which is tasty and the restaurant was very busy (Saturday night), but the food was less than desirable how and when it was served.  The staff apologized and they did discount the food, so they did try and make it right. My biggest issue with the whole food experience is this has happened to me before with a large group here.    As far as the ambiance goes, this place is 'loungey' as the name says, with dark corners, dim lighting and cozy seating.  There is usually a band or a DJ playing enjoyable/soothing tunes.  It was dead when we arrived, but it picked up around 9...I am not complaining though because we were therefor able to have an outstanding bar experience.   Main point:  Go to Casablanca for drinks and the lounge...not the food.

AVILLvVoc0ZBLwEklmGsHw.text: Sat at the bar on a Thursday night and the place was empty but seemed cool. the cheese plate was the best I've ever had. Good experience....

1iIZUBQzDrGzVfDATIQTYg.text: The pros: cool place, nice decor, not too loud, comfy seating, great outdoor patio areas, Yummy drinks, nice crowd but not overcrowded. The cons: tip was added to bill, and when I paid, waitress never brought me back my change. Very tacky.

j1RZwKOTGjAsG_-W3O7NKA.text: Horrible place! Mangers and bartenders are very rude! I'm a bartender and I will never treat ppl the way they do. They hate friday nights with African Americans.. They all act like we don't tip!! It's sad.. We're all not the same. But they see why all the other clubs in the area out beat them every weekend.. Because they don't know how to treat ppl!

LQLjJl8Hm6trkX-gto4ZbA.text: The patio...awesome.   I went on recommendation from a friend of mine who took his wife there for their first date, now I found out why he got a second one. Tasty cocktails for my lady, craft beer for me, both were tremendous. The food was even better, and the staff was on point. Next time I'll have to check out the whiskey selection, and if I'm feeling froggy I'll have to acquire a cigar for the patio. I just missed the tequila dinner, which isn't really my thing but they did say that they are doing beer dinners, which is RIGHT up my alley. I immediately signed up for the mailing list, and look forward to the next one.

tcNJpCkHoXYGR9J_U51--g.text: to the extent that this site is for rating places according to their food, please ignore this post.  We did not eat here, just came in to hear the "live" music.  Caveat for those of you who think that "live" music connotes human being(s) playing some kind of instrument (s), usually with vocal accompaniment.  A guy with all kinds of fancy electronics and lighting, thumping out mixes of dance-inducing R&B, as talented as the guy was here, is not "live" music and should not be advertised as such, IMHO.  That said, the Saturday night crowd was having a great time, and the patio seemed like a very nice setting for dining out above the fray.

BLHgKVmjB2t6AoDVQXZaIA.text: I was here back in 10/13 and thought this place was on its way out. Thankfully the little details that make a nightspot a gem were all addressed. Diversity, Class & it seemed like folks come to Casablanca to have fun. 1. ALL the staff were on point. From the gal at the door; the bouncers were cool; the bartenders were smooth with drink prep. Who slices a lemon to rub on the rim of a glass and then takes a towel to wipe the glass down???? I'd expect that from a place charging more than just $10 at the door. Nice touch. The guy in the restroom seemed like he knew each paper towel personally & actually pointed out an upturned collar and another dudes tie that was tucked into his pants. Classy. 2. The live music. The band was SWIF Music...hands down the best band I've seen in AZ. PERIOD. A full band playing R&B and doing it well....never seen it before in AZ. They had the floor packed & folks were getting it in. The back vocalists were dancing, the lead was dancing. If you've ever seen a local band with big talent, you'll know how it felt. They had a song about remembering to visit the bartenders. You'd think it would come off as trashy but they grooved it. They did Treasure by Bruno Mars & Remember the Time by MJ back to back and killed both of em. If you like live R&B with a seamless band, you can pay $$$ to see Mint Condition or you can check SWIF out. (facebook.com/SwifMusic) 3. Patrons. It looked initially like the normal mix of scottsdale pretty people and the folks that came to watch/touch them. That changed quick. This goes back to the band cuz they turned up the energy and the well dressed folks in the room started dancing. It was over from there. I like seeing folks that put in effort to look their best put in work on the floor. Old folks, young, white & black....everybody was rocking. This mix is seen all over scottsdale but not in such a classy & fun way. 4. DJ's. Reggae outside and a ridiculous 90's/Top 40 mix that never sagged indoors. The DJ's were in tune with the room and it showed. The owners & investors at Casablanca should be very proud.

fZ9qvEKsxCyKqTsgfndaVA.text: Love the atmosphere. You feel like you're in an exclusive speakeasy. There is a pleasure associated with sipping a refreshing cocktail on a warm day, while looking out over bustling old town Scottsdale. Great view of the camel's hump as well.

46ywKN8yWgtVsU9t_Uw6Vw.text: This place was really cool. You can call for a reservation or make one at Opentable.com (which is what I did). The one complaint I had (lets get it out of the way now) is that I tried to reserve a table for 8 (girls night out) and opentable kept giving me the message that that wouldnt be possible for several months. When we got there, it was empty, and even after it filled up there were plenty of tables for a party that size wide open. Ok. Glad I got that out of my system. The ambiance here is great. Dimly lit, very lavish comfortable seating areas. The staff was friendly and the menus light up! I just think that thats a brilliant idea. There are so many places that I see people using their cell phone to read menus or sign their tabs. here, both the menu and tab jacket light up. They also leave an Ipad at your table that has lists of all their cocktails, beers, wines, and spirits at your table. Which was cool. I had their cocktail that has "japanese" in the title. It was good, but not really my thing. My second drink was mixed beautifully however. I was suprised at how limited their vodka selection was though (personal preference). All in all, this was a great place to start the evening.

7E1y-iltsjEcEIoqPR2VRw.text: Disappointing to say the least. Couldn't get any bartenders or any staff member for that matter attention inside or outside. When we finally got a bartenders attention and asked for a menu she said they didn't have one and didn't even try to locate one for us.  Maybe it was an off night.

6RrRZlnKig70sRq-yInxTw.text: What a great lounge to go to after dinner. The DJ outside on deck was playing some tunes I hadn't heard in a long time and you couldn't help but either sing along and dance or even say " yes that is my jam. Oh and let us not forget the live band that was playing inside. *side note: you could not hear the band inside while sitting outside and vice versa. Loved that" *  Back to the band, Vaughn Willis and the band were on fire! It was a great way to end my 40th birthday celebration. Great company, great dj, great band, great drinks, one hell of a good time!
